abstract: If regulators penalize Comcast for blocking some Internet file downloads, it would be a victory for advocates of an open Internet. But it could end up accelerating the move by Internet providers to make heavy users charge more.
snippet: If regulators penalize Comcast for blocking some Internet file downloads, it would be a victory for advocates of an open Internet. But it could end up accelerating the move by Internet providers to make heavy users charge more.
lead_paragraph: UPDATED| 2:00 p.m. Added comments from Friday news conference

headline.main: An Imminent Victory for ‘Net Neutrality’ Advocates
